title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Kato (2025). apportita: Utility Handling 'magnitude' Word Embeddings. R package version 0.0.5, https://paithiov909.github.io/apportita/, https://github.com/paithiov909/apportita.
code: @Manual{,   title = {apportita: Utility for Handling 'magnitude' Word Embeddings},   author = {Akiru Kato},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.5,     https://paithiov909.github.io/apportita/},   url = {https://github.com/paithiov909/apportita}, }

what: Utility for Handling magnitude Word Embeddings
title: Utility for Handling magnitude Word Embeddings
text: Apportita partial R port plasticityai/magnitude, fast, simple utility library handling vector embeddings. Apportita cover partial features original Magnitude library. main goal package enable access user’s local magnitude data store. words, apportita support streaming access remote sqlite files. package mainly targets range magnitude-light library , thus functionalities implemented.

title: Utility for Handling magnitude Word Embeddings
text: Remember close connection querying Magnitude table.
code: library(apportita)  ## apportita includes a sample magnitude file ## trained with `movie_review` dataset from 'text2vec' package. conn <- apportita::magnitude(system.file("magnitude/w2v_en_sample.magnitude", package = "apportita"))  dim(conn) ## check the dimension of Magnitude table #> [1] 12711    20 close(conn)

title: Utility for Handling magnitude Word Embeddings
code: apportita::query(conn, c("i", "watch", "a", "movie")) #> # A tibble: 4 × 21 #>   key   dim_0   dim_1  dim_2   dim_3   dim_4  dim_5   dim_6 dim_7  dim_8  dim_9 #>   <chr> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 a     0.450 -0.183   0.197 -0.0840 -0.117  -0.134 -0.0380 0.200 0.232  -0.248 #> 2 i     0.453 -0.102   0.152  0.0377 -0.0414 -0.121 -0.181  0.115 0.0691 -0.316 #> 3 movie 0.277  0.0376 -0.144 -0.391  -0.135  -0.111  0.100  0.242 0.295  -0.147 #> 4 watch 0.327  0.172  -0.266 -0.0383 -0.190  -0.233 -0.343  0.206 0.127  -0.173 #> # … with 10 more variables: dim_10 <dbl>, dim_11 <dbl>, dim_12 <dbl>, #> #   dim_13 <dbl>, dim_14 <dbl>, dim_15 <dbl>, dim_16 <dbl>, dim_17 <dbl>, #> #   dim_18 <dbl>, dim_19 <dbl>  apportita::doesnt_match(conn, "book", c("i", "love", "movie"), n = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   keys  distance #>   <chr>    <dbl> #> 1 i        0.948 #> 2 love     0.746 #> 3 movie    0.609  apportita::most_similar(conn, "book", c("i", "love", "movie"), n = 3) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   keys  similarity #>   <chr>      <dbl> #> 1 movie      0.815 #> 2 love       0.722 #> 3 i          0.551

what: Calculate distance/similarity from words to words
title: Utility for Handling magnitude Word Embeddings
text: Apportita supports methods provided proxyC package calculating distances similarities. Experimentally, apportita::calc_wrd also supports computing Word Rotator’s Distance, textual similarity measure based optimal transport, presented https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.15003.
code: apportita::calc_dist(conn, "book", c("i", "love", "movie")) #> 1 x 3 sparse Matrix of class "dgTMatrix" #>              i      love     movie #> book 0.9480003 0.7461417 0.6085849  apportita::calc_simil(conn, "book", c("i", "love", "movie")) #> 1 x 3 sparse Matrix of class "dgTMatrix" #>              i      love     movie #> book 0.5506478 0.7216363 0.8148123 apportita::calc_wrd(conn, c("i", "love", "movie"), c("the", "movie", "shows", "blue", "sky")) #> [1] 0.3716493

title: Get vector embeddings of keys — query
code: query(   conn,   q,   normalized = TRUE,   ngram_beg = NULL,   ngram_end = NULL,   topn = 5L )

title: Get vector embeddings of keys — query
text: conn Magnitude connection. q character vector. normalized logical; whether vector embeddings normalized? ngram_beg integer. supplied, function gets --vocabulary vectors using character ngrams length `ngram_end - ngram_beg`. ngram_end integer. topn integer used making --vocabulary vectors.
